25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba (14:19): is 'WHATWG: http://www.whatwg.org/ -- logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ -- stats: http://gavinsharp.com/irc/whatwg.html -- Please leave your sense of logic at the door, thanks!'
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:20): http://livedom.validator.nu/ now has the latest parser version deployed
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (14:26): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, see "URL-encoded form data"
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (14:53): that's just the encoding end, as expected
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): http://www.guardian.co.uk/environment/2009/dec/22/copenhagen-climate-change-mark-lynas
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (14:59): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: it is at these moments that we wish there was a public transcript of the discussions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:59): oops. wrong window. sorry about the off-topic URL
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (15:10): http://rebuildingtheweb.com/en/html5-make-web-more-invalid/

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:15): Sounds like it's arguing that HTML5 makes the concept of validity much less important (because it removes the link between validity and interoperability / forward-compatibility)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:15): and so people will focus less on validity
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:15): since everything will work fine for them anyway
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:15): and, uh, somehow that's a bad thing (?)
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (15:15): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342, maybe you should file a bug and say that it should define server requirements as well
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:15): We have pretty uniform behaviour already though
4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b (15:15): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342, would be somewhat logical
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I thought HTML5 doesn't move the link between validity and forward compat
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:16): everything invalid is reserved for future specs
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:16): I don't see anything in that post saying why "invalid" content is actually bad
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:17): (of course, if you deploy a given piece of syntax enough, it'll show up as a legacy constraint on what future specs can say)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:17): (so you only get burned if you make stuff up and aren't successful in deploying it widely)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:17): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: That's true, but it's not what the mentioned post is arguing
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:40): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: There's a second, underlying assumption, that valid == best practice (and probably also XHTML :P)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (15:41): 4d647473081c3ad729446a01a377813b: I'll do that if no one in the media fragments WG can find a spec which we can use
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:45): i think html5 should define it regardless
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:46): well, as long as it's the spec that defines how to serialize
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:52): Today I broke my rule of not redeploying V.nu before a vacation. I hope it stays up for the rest of the year...
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (15:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Happen to see my message about localents not fixing the CCE?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:53): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: hmm. that's odd. usually it fixes the problem
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:54): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: it's a problem with the local entity cache being corrupt somehow
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:54): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: I suggest trying to delete the local cache and then running localent
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (15:54): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: It's very reproducible for me.  If I execute "all" twice in a row, it works fine.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (15:55): I've just taken to making a tarball of my distribution and throwing it up on S3.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (15:55): I found the only way I could detach from the TTY, too, was to add a stop port to the jetty command.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (15:56): I think it's because Main has a System.in.read();
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:09): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: http://pastebin.mozilla.org/692476 works for me for detaching from TTY
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:09): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: You added a stop port there, too.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:09): Without it, it tries to read from stdin, it seems.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:10): And then immediately stops the server.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:10): I spent a few hours trying to figure out why I could get as far as binding to the port and then the process would just kill itself.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:11): clearly, I should do a better job with documenting my deployment procedure

ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:12): I'd really like to take a stab at building a web app directory structure at the very least.  Going to WAR from there is simple.  It'd simplify deployment considerably.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:12): depends on how one is deploying
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:13): having worked on Java enterprise software and having written my of main() for Jetty, I vastly prefer writing my own main() for Jetty

ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:14): Well, if I want to use an existing app server, I could just plop it in and use my existing init scripts and monitoring tools.  If I were to still the embedded jetty you have, I wouldn't need to add all those classpath entries.  It'd just be an easier command to execute.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:14): I don't think you lose anything.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:14): 5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197bting up a WebAppContext in Jetty is pretty straightforward.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:15): classpath hell is bad enough with plain Java apps, I don't really want to deploy with more run-time classloader tricks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:15): like an app server running itself and the .war under different classloaders or whatever
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:15): I am willing to consider patches for building a .war, though
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:16): Well, what I was initially proposing was just a more standard approach to running the app in the embedded container *shrug*
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:16): But I agree.  You don't want to be debugging people JBoss issues, for example.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:17): fwiw, V.nu at least at one point supported running inside W3C Jigsaw
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:17): which is yet different
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:17): I run the CSS validator as a WAR in Jetty.  I think that was designed to run in Jigsaw.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:17): So, maybe they've cleaned that up a bit.

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:21): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: anyway, I understand that others may prefer to deploy a .war and I'm willing to accept code to enable it, but I don't see a compelling benefit to the deployment of the instances I'm running
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:22): btw, one reason of having my own main() is making debugging in Eclipse super-simple
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:22): Fair enough.  I'm just looking that I killed about 10 hours yesterday trying to get everything going.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I normally handle that by add a TestMain class or whatever to my test classpath and execute from there.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:24): Another issue I had run into is that mercurial is a required dependency.  I can file an issue to add that to the docs.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:24): It's been years since I've used bugzilla, though.  Hopefully I remember my way around ;-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:25): sorry about the defective docs and the unusual deployment
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:25): Eh, no worries.  I'm just trying to think of ways to make it easier for the next time.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:26): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: did Jing's datatype library loading code work ok under your app server?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:26): ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc: previously, when I tried to sandbox the code, I gave up because what I did disrupted Jing's classloader tricks

ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:27): I guess so?  I got the embedded Jetty server up and could validate an HMTL 5 site, both from the server directly and from the W3C validator frontended to the nu validator.
ba4e9a4564de83f3e82db374f7a546bc (16:27): But, I really didn't try any other doc types.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:44): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: fwiw, I figured out the cause of my problem with v.nu not actually accepting connections
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:44): http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=560056
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:45): latest debian "netbase" package sets a new kernel param
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:45): net.ipv6.bindv6only=1
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:46): that totally muffs up all java networking
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:47): dunno
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:47): I can try it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:48): I don't know what that syntax means
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:49): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yeah, that works even when  net.ipv6.bindv6only=1
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:49): so what does "[::1]" mean?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:52): steps away for a bit
ab5a3c1ba5a4b0308a98e2258a2a1e70 (16:58): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, ipv6 equivalent of 127.0.0.1
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:02): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: What ab5a3c1ba5a4b0308a98e2258a2a1e70 said
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:02): http://rebuildingtheweb.com/en/ is pretty much like our other fan site in a slightly different tone...
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:02): ::1 is like 127.0.0.1, [::1] is how you write it in URLs to be unambiguous
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, feel free to post such off-topic links btw
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I'd go as far as encouraging it :)
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (17:15): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: just realized that it was written by Vlad Alexander http://rebuildingtheweb.com/en/about/
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:26): there's a lot less email these past few days
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:26): very nice
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:26): Just wait until a microdata decision is made
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:28): when is that?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:28): after the holidays somewhere?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:28): shrugs
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (17:29): looks forward to another cycle of the same nonsense
ab5a3c1ba5a4b0308a98e2258a2a1e70 (17:31): what decision is there to be made?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:32): Whether it should be split out of the W3C's HTML5 document or not
ab5a3c1ba5a4b0308a98e2258a2a1e70 (17:33): what should?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:33): All the bits to do with microdata
